an4.99:1.1: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.
an4.99:1.3: One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others;
an4.99:1.4: one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;
an4.99:1.5: one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and
an4.99:1.6: one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.
an4.99:2.1: And how does an individual practice to benefit themselves, but not others?
an4.99:2.2: It’s when an individual doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. But they don’t encourage others to do the same.
an4.99:2.7: That’s how an individual practices to benefit themselves, but not others.
an4.99:3.1: And how does an individual practice to benefit others, but not themselves?
an4.99:3.2: It’s when an individual kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. But they encourage others to not do these things.
an4.99:3.7: That’s how an individual practices to benefit others, but not themselves.
an4.99:4.1: And how does a person practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?
an4.99:4.2: It’s when an individual kills, etc. … and doesn’t encourage others to not do these things.
an4.99:4.3: That’s how an individual practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.
an4.99:5.1: And how does an individual practice to benefit both themselves and others?
an4.99:5.2: It’s when an individual doesn’t kill, etc. … and encourages others to do the same.
an4.99:5.3: That’s how an individual practices to benefit both themselves and others.
an4.99:5.4: These are the four individuals found in the world.”
